errors.error_description: The command to upgrade the package using pip is incorrect. The `--update` flag is not a valid flag for `pip install`; the correct flag is `--upgrade`.
The command `censys config --all` is not a valid command for configuring credentials. The correct command is simply `censys config`.
The README states that 'Python 3 is currently supported', which is too vague. The library specifically requires Python 3.8 or newer.
correction_candidates: Any version of Python 3 is supported.

errors.error_description: The development setup instructions incorrectly place `poetry install` before cloning the repository. The repository must be cloned first to access the project directory.
correction_candidates: First, run `git clone git@github.com:censys/censys-python.git`, then `cd censys-python/`, and finally `poetry install`.
First, run `poetry new censys-python`, then `cd censys-python/`, and finally `poetry install`.
First, run `poetry install`, then `git clone git@github.com:censys/censys-python.git` inside the new environment.
Run `poetry shell` and then `git clone git@github.com:censys/censys-python.git`.
errors.golden_answer: First, run `git clone git@github.com:censys/censys-python.git`, then `cd censys-python/`, and finally `poetry install`.

errors.error_description: The command provided to enable tab completion is incorrect and will not work as written. It needs to be evaluated by the shell using `eval`.
The path to the examples directory is incorrect. The README refers to `example/`, but the correct directory name is `examples/`.
correction_candidates: The examples located in the `examples/` directory...
The examples located in the `docs/examples/` directory...
The examples located in the `scripts/` directory...
The examples located in the `tests/` directory...
errors.golden_answer: The examples located in the `examples/` directory...

errors.error_description: The command `poetry add censys` is used to add a new dependency from PyPI, not to install existing project dependencies from a `poetry.lock` file. The correct command is `poetry install`.
The instruction for configuring ASM credentials incorrectly states to run `censys config` and shows the same command in the example block. The correct command for ASM is `censys asm config`.
correction_candidates: ...you can configure your ASM credentials by running `censys asm config`...
...you can configure your ASM credentials by running `censys config --asm`...
...you can configure your ASM credentials by editing the `~/.censys/censys.cfg` file directly...
...you can configure your ASM credentials by running `censys asm init`...
errors.golden_answer: ...you can configure your ASM credentials by running `censys asm config`...

errors.error_description: Changed the logical order of poetry installation steps by running 'poetry install' before changing to the project directory with 'cd censys-python/'
correction_candidates:
git clone https://github.com/censys/censys-python.git
cd censys-python/
poetry install

cd censys-python/
git clone https://github.com/censys/censys-python.git
poetry install

git clone https://github.com/censys/censys-python.git
poetry init
cd censys-python/
poetry install
errors.golden_answer:
git clone https://github.com/censys/censys-python.git
cd censys-python/
poetry install
